alert.note: Alert for Elk; Labette; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Elk, southern Wilson, northern Labette, Neosho, northern Montgomery and Chautauqua Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Walnut to 7 miles northeast of Cedar Vale. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Independence, Neodesha, Cherryvale, Erie, Sedan, St. Paul, Cedar Vale, Thayer, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Elk City, Galesburg, Elk Falls, Bolton, Sycamore, Stark, Earlton and Parsons Tri City Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
